title: Adair Family Homestead; Riding Stride Saddle
description: Adair homestead was between Bovill and Collins. The girls rode stride saddles. A bucking horse and divided skirts. An Indian horse with ears and tail bobbed as a punishment. Slippery trails. Father insisted they ride stride saddles, although some townspeople wondered. Mother was a good shot, but too busy to ride much.

title: Fourth of July at Elf River Falls; The Trumball family
description: Elk River Falls. The Trumball family. Invited to spend the Fourth of July weekend there, the girls were the first to catch the fish Trumball had planted. Bernadine freed a native pheasant. Her .38 special revolver, a constant companion in the woods.

title: Visitors from Bovill; The Bovill girls' birthday party
description: Arrival of Bovill family to graze cattle; they soon had a trade with homesteaders. Trustees of the Collins school. A surprise visit from the county superintendent, when Miss Adair had dismissed school at Collins to come to the Bovill girls' birthday party.

title: Adair Family Trip to Collins
description: Adair farm location. The family made the trip to Collins in one day, stopping for lunch at Anderson.

title: Packrats; Homesteading
description: Packrats chunked their cabin with potatoes. House-lining. Mother didn't enjoy homesteading, but did it to help. A friend would stay with her in the upstairs loft. Beargrass mattresses in the barn

title: Big Fire of 1910
description: Her experience of the 1910 fire. The hazy conditions. As she and her friend prepared to seek out other Homesteaders, a fire crew arrived and enlisted their help to cook for them. Potatoes and bannock. Moving with the crew. Concern when short-term folks joined the crew - two men and her gun insured their protection. Pay. Excitement of the situation. Trying to stay clean. Parents didn't know what had happened to her.

title: Returning to Moscow after the 1910 Fire
description: Return from fire fighting to Moscow, via the train from Avery. They took their clothes in salt sacks.

title: Adair Family Pet Bear; University of Iowa's mascot
description: The Adair's pet bear at the mansion. He got loose in the house; he climbed a maple tree. Discovery of the bear. The bear became University of Iowa mascot. The bear ripped a visitor's trousers. The bear's playfulness.

title: Selling the homestead to by a mansion
description: Mr. Adair bought the mansion by selling his homestead to the Madison Lumber Company.

title: Story of Ben and Bill McConnell; Political life
description: Mrs. McConnell never had her picture taken. The Adairs supplied a Kodak snapshot of her in recent years. Mrs. McConnell was shy and did not like political life. She stayed home when he was governor; daughter Mamie acted as his hostess in Boise and met Senator Borah there.

title: Story of Ben and Bill McConnell
description: Story of Ben and Bill McConnell (continued).

title: More Stories of Ben and Bill McConnell; McConnell daughters
description: More about the McConnells. The unusual lives of the sons. Governor McConnell was a politician. McConnell daughters.

title: M.J. Shields
description: How M.J. Shields talked to himself.

title: Birthday Rhyme
description: A birthday rhyme on getting old.

title: Forty-Nine Meadows; Exercising in the winter
description: A horse drowned in the soggy depths of Forty-Nine Meadows. Trapping with Mr. Carter and "Sylves", the dead horse. Father told the girls to exercise in the winter.

title: Drunken Stagecoach Rider
description: Carter gave a stagecoach ride to a drunk who was amazed by the moonlight.
